ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In this course I was exposed for the first time to the discipline of religious studies and was immediately intrigued by it. Besides what I learned about apocalypticism, I was also indebted to this course for igniting my curiosity about the ancient world.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I appreciate the fact that the professors approach the texts with the context in mind without being historicist. Bringing in texts from various religious traditions also helps the students understand the prevalence of apocalyptic thinking and its relevance to the contemporary world. It is wonderful that the theme of apocalcypticism is examined with an interdisciplinary approach, with a focus on the fundamental texts and issues transcending disciplinary boundaries.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Students with an interest in philosophy, religious studies, intellectual history, and the ancient world would learn much in this course.
